text: Arvin Vohra (born May 9, 1979) is an American politician, author and educator. He was the vice-chairman of the Libertarian National Committee from 2014 to 2018. Vohra ran for the Maryland House of Delegates once, and for U.S. House twice, as a Libertarian. He was a candidate for U.S. Senate in the 2018 election in Maryland, but lost the current Senator Ben Cardin. In July 2018, Vohra announced his plans to run for President of the United States in the 2020 election. ==References== Category:2020 United States presidential candidates Category:1979 births Category:Living people Category:American political writers Category:Educators from Maryland Category:Politicians from Maryland Category:Writers from Maryland Category:People from Silver Spring, Maryland Category:Libertarian Party (United States) politicians
title: Arvin Vohra
